Brown has been charged with first-degree murder, raising concerns about transit safety and prompting increased security measures.

title: Starlink India push: Musk’s firm in talks with data centres, telcos; groundwork begins
description: Starlink is actively establishing its terrestrial infrastructure in India, engaging in advanced discussions with data center operators, internet exchange providers, and telecom companies. These strategic tie-ups aim to support large-scale satellite connectivity, positioning Starlink to compete in India's growing satcom market.

title: FATF lauds work of MHA's portal for international cooperation
description: The FATF report commends India's online MLA portal for streamlining international cooperation in money laundering cases. An ED investigation, in collaboration with the US DOJ, dismantled a darknet-based Fentanyl syndicate, seizing significant Bitcoin assets. This joint effort highlights effective cross-border coordination and India's enhanced capacity for international legal assistance.

title: A private broom: Chennai’s conservancy woes
description: For a few weeks now, conservancy workers in Chennai, who had to shift to private operators, have protested against the loss of income and chances of a permanent job. While this issue has sparked a critique of public-private partnership for core civic tasks, the problems of the workers remain unresolved, write Aloysius Xavier Lopez and R. Aishwaryaa

title: UP syncs rules for stray dogs with Supreme Court’s order
Minnesota: Helicopter crashes near Airlake Airport, bursts into flames
description: A Robinson R66 helicopter crashed and caught fire near Airlake Airport in Minnesota on Saturday afternoon, resulting in no survivors. The crash occurred in a non-residential area, with the NTSB and FAA launching an investigation into the cause. The helicopter, which can seat up to five people, was found west of the airport.

Princess Kate, patron of the Rugby Football Union, cheered for England against Australia in East Sussex. Meanwhile, Prince William, patron of the Welsh Rugby Union, supported Wales in their match against Fiji in Exeter.

description: A massive immigration raid at a Hyundai plant in Georgia led to the arrest of 475 workers, predominantly Korean nationals, triggering diplomatic intervention from South Korea. Federal agents executed the operation following a months-long investigation into unlawful employment practices. The raid involved multiple agencies, highlighting a crackdown on workforce exploitation and federal law violations, as stated by Homeland Security.

description: A recent study by IITM reveals Delhi's air contains the highest mercury concentration among Indian cities, significantly exceeding global background levels. The study, spanning from 2018 to 2024, links the pollution to coal use, traffic, and industries. While Delhi's mercury levels are alarming, the research indicates a decline compared to previous years.

Kumar falsely implicated Firoz in a terror plot, claiming 34 bombs were planted and Pakistani terrorists had infiltrated the city.

title: PM Modi dinner with NDA MPs called off amid floods across states
description: In light of the widespread devastation caused by severe floods in Punjab and other regions of India, BJP President JP Nadda's dinner for NDA MPs on Saturday and Prime Minister Modi's dinner on Sunday, scheduled before the Vice Presidential elections, have been cancelled. PM Modi is expected to visit the flood-affected areas.

title: Rajasthan: 20 deaths in police lock-up in 2 years; govt report indicates a pattern
description: A Rajasthan government report reveals 20 custodial deaths in police lock-ups between August 2023 and August 2025, attributed to health issues, suicides, and one disputed case. Despite recurring patterns and procedural lapses, investigations have largely cleared police personnel, resulting in minor disciplinary actions. The Supreme Court is now examining compliance with CCTV mandates amid concerns over custodial deaths.

title: 9-year-old’s body found in pond in West Bengal, mob lynch neighbours on suspicion
description: A nine-year-old's death in Tehatta, Nadia district, triggered a violent mob lynching. Swarnabha Mondal, missing since Friday, was found dead in a pond. Locals, suspecting Utpal and Soma Biswas due to a family feud, attacked their home, resulting in their deaths. Police inaction is alleged, with locals claiming quicker response could have prevented the tragedies. An investigation is underway.

title: Rila Monastery, a symbol of resilience of the human spirit
description: The monumental site, Bulgaria’s largest Eastern Orthodox monastery, is nestled in the highest mountain range in the Balkan Peninsula and southeast Europe

title: Carmelo Anthony Hall of Fame: How to watch live; date, time, streaming details
description: This weekend marks the induction of basketball icons like Carmelo Anthony, Maya Moore, and Dwight Howard into the Naismith Basketball Hall of Fame. Anthony, celebrated for his time with Syracuse and Team USA, will be presented by Dwyane Wade and Allen Iverson. The ceremony, a highlight for basketball enthusiasts, will be broadcast live from Springfield, Massachusetts.

title: Third wife, lover & aide bludgeon man, dump body in well; second wife raises alarm
description: In Anuppur district, a shocking crime unfolded as Bhaiyalal Rajak was murdered by his third wife, Munni, and her lover, Narayan Das Kushwaha. The couple, along with an accomplice, bludgeoned Bhaiyalal to death with an iron rod before disposing of his body in a well.

title: Haryana government transfers 20 IAS officers, 1 HCS officer in major reshuffle

title: Chiefs’ Xavier Worthy injury: Fans panic; experts weigh in — latest update
description: Kansas City Chiefs fans are anxious following reports of a potential shoulder dislocation for Xavier Worthy. A sports medicine specialist suggests a possible three-week recovery, but cautions about a high re-injury risk. Surgery, the worst-case scenario, could sideline Worthy for the season. His absence would force offensive adjustments, potentially impacting Mahomes and other receivers.

title: Mumbai bids grand farewell to ‘Ganpati Bappa’ amid rains, bomb threat; over 18,000 idols immersed
description: According to the BMC, 18,186 Ganapati idols, 1,058 of ‘sarvajanik mandals’ (local community groups) and 258 of Goddess idols, were immersed in natural water bodies and artificial ponds created by the civic body till 9 p.m.

title: Fastest lap in F1 history sees Verstappen take pole for Italian GP ahead of Norris and Piastri

title: Phillies Karen: From snagging Bader’s ball to viral backlash — America turns on her
description: During a Phillies-Marlins game, Harrison Bader hit a home run, which a father caught and gave to his son. A woman, dubbed "Phillies Karen," confronted them, claiming the ball was hers and demanding it. The incident sparked outrage online, but Bader later met the boy, signed a bat, and posed for photos to make up for the negative experience.

title: 'Crap note': Peter Navarro slams Musk’s X feature; renews attack on India
description: Former White House advisor Peter Navarro has accused India of profiteering from Russian oil purchases, alleging that India didn't buy any before the Ukraine invasion and is now fueling Russia's war efforts. These remarks have been strongly refuted by India's Ministry of External Affairs, which dismissed them as inaccurate and misleading.

title: Chhattisgarh: 8-yr-old girl forced to do 100 squats in class, left unable to walk
description: In Chhattisgarh's Surguja district, an eight-year-old girl is unable to walk after allegedly being forced to do 100 sit-ups and beaten by her teacher for using the toilet. The incident at a government-funded school led to muscle damage in her legs. Authorities have ordered an inquiry, and the school officials have been placed on leave.

title: Meta’s brain drain: Why AI engineers quit; startup CEO cites Zuckerberg’s own words
description: Memories.ai CEO Shawn Shen reveals that Meta's frequent reorganizations are driving AI researchers to seek opportunities elsewhere, including his own startup. Memories.ai is offering lucrative compensation packages, up to $2 million, to attract top talent. The company has already hired a former Meta research scientist as its chief AI officer and plans to expand its AI team significantly.
